transcript:
there's really only one reason people
change here it is people change when the
pain and fear associated with the risk
of change becomes greater than the pain
and fear associated with staying the
same it's a kind of hedonic calculus
that a person makes and until the one
seems to be not just greater but
significantly greater than the other
the status quo is maintained I say
significantly greater because there is a
risk it's kind of like the devil you
know versus the devil you don't and this
is why unfortunately sometimes it's the
case that people
need to suffer
as a Prelude to their actual growth and
development
